all_questions.question: What was the speaker's claim about the word error rates of different systems?
all_questions.context: So if we look at the word error rates, on the very first slide I was talking about the word error rate of 4%.

all_questions.question: How does the speaker define 'offline' in the context of system performance?
all_questions.context: And this is actually offline. So the recognition after the recording has been made, not the online mode.

all_questions.question: What happens to systems when the sound input is poor?
all_questions.context: So if the sound input is too bad, some of the systems really give up.

all_questions.question: How do the scores change when all recordings are evaluated and a system gives up?
all_questions.context: And if the system has given up. Then we will see that the scores are yet a bit worse, so the Google is giving up and it is approaching to total failure on that.

all_questions.question: What does the speaker mean by 'total failure' in this context?
all_questions.context: It's close to 100% of word error rate so nothing.
